channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The 3-Letter Word That Can Supercharge Your Career and Investments
item.description: Two house flippers buy similar deals—but one’s profit is double the other. Two wholesalers buy equivalent houses—but one offloads his for a $25,000 profit in a day, while the second […]

item.title: Jump raises $12M to help freelancers get benefits just like employees
item.description: Jump offers full-time contracts to freelancers looking for some stability and the benefits involved with a full-time job. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: How We Survived Extreme Heat in Prison
item.description: Incarcerated journalists detail the first signs of a heat wave in prison — and how they’ve coped with record-breaking temperatures.

item.title: The Best and Worst Places to Invest Based on Insurance Claim Data
item.description: Insurance costs are rising, and a select few markets are facing the brunt of the pressure. Meanwhile, some markets are doing just fine.

item.title: SoftBank’s Masayoshi Son has been planning his comeback
item.description: A new Financial Times profile of Mayayoshi Son opens with SoftBank’s CEO seeming to hit bottom, staring at his “ugly” face on Zoom and telling himself, “I have done nothing I can be proud of.” Indeed, Son largely disappeared from the public eye after SoftBank’s Vision Fund took huge losses from investments like WeWork. But […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Marshall Project to Host Inaugural Sing Sing Prison Film Festival
item.description: Incarcerated jury will choose best criminal justice documentary.

item.title: The 5 Most Profitable Cities for Short-Term Rentals in Florida
item.description: Florida might be one of the hottest Airbnb markets (literally, hot), but these five markets are the ones you'll want to pay more attention to.

item.title: Matt Mullenweg calls WP Engine a ‘cancer to WordPress’ and urges community to switch providers
item.description: Automattic CEO and WordPress co-creator Matt Mullenweg unleashed a scathing attack on a rival firm this week, calling WP Engine a “cancer to WordPress.” Mullenweg criticized the company — which has been commercializing the open source WordPress project since 2010 — for profiteering without giving much back, while also disabling key features that make WordPress […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Robert Roberson’s Death Penalty Case Shows How Justice System Fails People With Autism
item.description: He was convicted in his daughter’s death. Those who believe he’s innocent argue his diagnosis helps explain how he ended up facing execution.

item.title: My Foolproof Strategy for Earning a Higher ROI on Flips
item.description: The challenging aspect of any renovation is determining what to renovate and selecting appropriate finishes. There’s no one-size-fits-all rule for renovations and finishes guaranteeing the highest ROI. It largely depends […]

item.title: Synex founder, once detained at the border with an 80-pound magnet, is building portable MRIs to test glucose
item.description: Synex Medical just raised $21.8 million to build a portable MRI capable of testing glucose and other important molecules without the need to extract blood. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Could People Facing the Death Penalty Lose the Right to Tell Juries Their Life Stories?
item.description: Some defense lawyers fear that a conservative Supreme Court could overturn that precedent.

item.title: Is Refinancing Worth It with Today’s Falling Rates? (+ How Much It’ll Cost)
item.description: When should you refinance your mortgage? Is now the time since interest rates have finally fallen? Or will refinancing down to today’s rates not be worth it when, six months […]

item.title: Yup, Jony Ive is working on an AI device startup with OpenAI
item.description: Jony Ive, the legendary designer who left his full-time role at Apple five years ago, is working on a new startup with OpenAI and its CEO Sam Altman. The collaboration was first reported last year, and Ive confirmed it in a New York Times profile about what he’s been up to since leaving Apple. If […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: 5 Things to Know About How the Parkland Shooter’s Life Was Spared
item.description: Key takeaways from our investigation into how Nikolas Cruz’s defense team convinced jurors not to impose the death penalty.
